name: molar
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
one of the large teeth at the back of the mouth in humans and some other animals used for crushing and chewing food: I was having some pain in my upper right molar. Dental sealant can be painted on the molars and premolars to prevent tooth decay. Compare
canine noun (TOOTH)
incisor
gaetan stoffel/iStock/Getty Images Plus/GettyImages
More examplesFewer examplesThe molars were decayed to the gums.At this time the four adult front teeth and the adult first molars have usually erupted. Replacing missing molars with false teeth may have a cosmetic benefit but there is no health gain.

(of a liquid) containing one mole of a substance dissolved in each litre of liquid: A solution with a concentration of 1 mol/L is said to be 1 molar. A 0.1 molar solution of baking soda has a pH of around 8.3.
More examplesFewer examplesA molar solution is defined as an aqueous solution that contains 1 mole (gram-molecular weight) of a compound dissolved in 1 litre of a solution.For a 1/6 molar solution of sodium thiosulfate, use 4.14 g of sodium thiosulfate per 100 ml of sterile water.

molar noun [C]
(TOOTH)
any of the large teeth at the back of the mouth, used for crushing and chewing food
